ca.ualberta.trinkettrader

Class ApplicationState

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.trinkettrader.ApplicationState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observable

    public class ApplicationState
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observable
    Singleton utility class responsible for handling the clicking of friends in a user's friend's list, trinkets in a user's inventory, and trades in the user's active and past trade lists.

    Each time a friend, trinket, or trade is clicked in a list, this class will be used in the onItemClick method of the respective controller to set the object which was clicked.

    For more information, please see the respective controllers: for clicked friends - FriendsListController for clicked trinkets - InventoryController for clicked trades - ActiveTradesController , PastTradesController

      • getClickedTrade

        Returns:
        Trade returns clicked trade

      • setClickedTrade

        public void setClickedTrade(Trade clickedTrade)
        Sets the trinket most recently clicked on from the Active Trades ListView (currentTradesListView) or the Past Trades ListView (pastTradesListView). Once clicked, a trade will have been viewed by the user and will not be new anymore. This method calls 'setNotNewOfferedTrade' which removes the NEW! status of of the trade, which changes how the trade will be displayed in the Current Trades list.
        Parameters:
        clickedTrade - trade that was clicked

      • getInCounterTrade

        public java.lang.Boolean getInCounterTrade()
        Returns Boolean indicating if the user is involved in a counter trade. If inCounterTrade is true then the user is currently creating a counter trade, if it returns false then the user is not. A user can start a counter trade if a they reject a trade proposed to them in the TradeReceivedActivity, as they are then directed by the app to the CounterTradeActivity.
        Returns:
        Boolean - true if the user is currently in the CounterTradeActivity, false otherwise

      • setInCounterTrade

        public void setInCounterTrade(java.lang.Boolean inCounterTrade)
        Sets Boolean indicating if the user is involved in a counter trade. If inCounterTrade is true then the user is currently creating a counter trade, if it returns false then the user is not. A user can start a counter trade if a they reject a trade proposed to them in the TradeReceivedActivity, as they are then directed by the app to the CounterTradeActivity.
        Parameters:
        inCounterTrade - - true if the user is currently in the CounterTradeActivity, false otherwise

      • getFriendSpinnerPosition

        public java.lang.Integer getFriendSpinnerPosition()
        Returns the index of a Friend in the spinner listing all a user's Friends. This spinner is used in CreateTradeActivity to select which Friend to trade with.
        Returns:
        Integer - index describing the position of a Friend in a spinner of friends

      • setFriendSpinnerPosition

        Parameters:
        friendSpinnerPosition - - index describing the position of a Friend in a spinner of friends

        public void addObserver(java.util.Observer observer)
        Adds the specified observer to the list of observers. If it is already registered, it is not added a second time.

      • deleteObserver

        public void deleteObserver(java.util.Observer observer)
        Removes the specified observer from the list of observers. Passing null won't do anything.
        Specified by:
        deleteObserver in interface Observable
        Parameters:
        observer - the observer to remove.

      • notifyObservers

        public void notifyObservers()
        If hasChanged() returns true, calls the update() method for every observer in the list of observers using null as the argument. Afterwards, calls clearChanged().

        Equivalent to calling notifyObservers(null).

        Specified by:
        notifyObservers in interface Observable
